title: Digital Microfluidics Controller
description: Digital microfluidic technology has become a popular platform for point-of-care diagnostics as it allows automated processing of droplet sized samples - my research focuses on the development of this technology. Thus, I have created and tested a 4 layer PCB and user-friendly GUI software for easily configuring and automating experiments on the chip.

title: This Portfolio Website!
description: Created with mobile first design, this site was built with React, Redux, React-Router, React-Transition-Group and SASS. Using purely functional components, I dug into React Hooks and Redux store management. This site was a joy to build and I hope you enjoy viewing it half as much as I did making it!

title: Win32 Sudoku Solver
description: A super lightweight application to visualize the DFS back-tracking algorithm at work! The user can provide a sudoku puzzle (or load from application's local memory), set the solving speed and watch the process. Developed in C and Win32, this project allowed me to deeply understand event driven programming and the basics of multithreading.

title: ARM Cortex M4 Drivers
description: I undertook this project to strengthen my understanding of the ARM Cortex M architecture and digital communication protocols. Drivers for IRQ configuration, GPIO pins, SPI, I2C, UART/USART and the System Timer have been programmed and tested on a STM32F446RE based development board.

title: LED Light Strip Controller
description: Decorative LED light strip controller built with an Arduino Nano controller on a custom 2 layer PCB. User can switch between the following 3 modes on button press: static colour, pattern display and music visualizer. Parameters including colour, brightness and sensitivity are tunable with potentiometers.

title: Literature Blog - rahulscorner.me
description: My personal blog where I share articles and recommendations of books that have shaped my life! Built using React (with hooks), React-Router, React-Helmet and SASS. The site features light and dark modes. An earlier version built with PHP7 and vanilla JS is available at my github.

title: Rubikloud - Retail Customer Predictions
description: The final project in my introductory machine learning course. Given a dataset of over 1 million anonimized retail transactions, I was tasked with predicting each customer's likelihood to purchase from a top 5 brand during a 3 month period. Evaluated on the test data, a random forest model produced the best ROC curve with average AUC of 0.946.

title: OTTOGROW Hydroponics Grower
description: A complete hardware and software solution system for regulating nutrient ion concentration in hydroponic growing systems. Presented as my capstone engineering project, this device used a closed loop control system to keep nutrient concentrations in irrigation fluid within a user determined concentration range. Using an ISE sensor, solenoid valve actuation, Arduino microcontroller and LabVIEW UI.
